text.name: sys_description
text.text: Released in 1994, the Saturn is Sega's 32-bit console. Being its sixth console, its name derives from the sixth planet of the solar system. Fruit of the efforts of Sega of Japan then in competition with Sega of America and the 32X, it possesses 11 processors, 2 MB of RAM and a display in 320x240, 640x240 up to 60 fps. It generates up to 300,000 textured polygons, 750,000 shading per second, and 32 PCM and FM voices for sound. Despite its commercial failure and complex programming, it has cult games like Nights into Dreams, Sega Rally, Panzer Dragoon, among others.
